alert.note: Alert for Garza (Texas) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.senderName: NWS Lubbock (Lubbock and South Plains Texas)
info.headline: Flood Advisory issued October 03 at 3:00AM CDT until October 03 at 7:00AM CDT by NWS Lubbock
info.description: ...FLOOD ADVISORY IN EFFECT UNTIL 430 AM CDT EARLY THIS MORNING... * WHAT...Flooding caused by excessive rainfall is expected. * WHERE...Portions of Garza County. * WHEN...Until 430 AM CDT. * IMPACTS...Minor flooding in low-lying and poor drainage areas. Water over roadways. Overflowing poor drainage areas. * ADDITIONAL DETAILS... - At 259 AM CDT, Doppler radar and automated rain gauges indicated heavy rain due to thunderstorms. The West Texas Mesonet site in Post recorded 0.5 inches of rain in only 5 minutes. Minor flooding is ongoing or expected to begin shortly in the advisory area. Up to 1.5 inches of rain has fallen. - Additional rainfall amounts up to 1 inch are possible over the area. This additional rain will result in minor flooding. - Some locations that will experience flooding include... Post and Justiceburg. - http://www.weather.gov/safety/flood
info.instruction: Be especially cautious at night when it is harder to recognize the dangers of flooding. Be aware of your surroundings and do not drive on flooded roads.
